resources.string: The Broyhill Wind Turbine is a project of the Appalachian State University Renewable Energy Initiative (ASUREI).
The turbine is a Northern Power Systems Northwind 100 kW turbine, with 21 meter blades on a 37 meter tower.
ASUREI partnered with New River Light and Power to build the turbine, with ASUREI contributing $319,800 and NRLP contributing the remaining $213,200.
It is located at the Broyhill Inn and Conference Center, 775 Bodenheimer Dr., Boone, NC.
The Broyhill Wind Turbine is the largest wind turbine in North Carolina, and produces up to 147,000 kWh annually.
It was place into service on June 22, 2009.
There are currently no further (publicly announced) plans for the Broyhill Wind Turbine. However, you can view ASUREI\'s other projects at:
